title: Region bounded by SQRTx and y=6-x part - c

content.description: The functions f and g are given by \(f\left(x\right)=\sqrt{x}\) and g(x) = 6 - x. Let R be the region bounded by the x-axis and the graphs of f and g, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: There is a point P on the graph of f at which the line tangent to the graph of f is perpendicular to the graph of g. Find the coordinates of point P.

frqParts.text: There is a point P on the graph of f at which the line tangent to the graph of f is perpendicular to the graph of g. Find the coordinates of point P.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
